content:
Drug: Gabapentin | cid: 3446
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about Gabapentin (Neurontin) including uses, images, dosage, effects, legal status, and links to other resources.
Erowid name: gabapentin
Category: PHARMS
Field: MainPage

                    Text: 
                    Follow @Erowid on Instagram!

Gabapentin



COMMON & BRAND NAMES

Neurontin

EFFECTS CLASSIFICATION

Anticonvulsant; Tranquilizer

CHEMICAL NAME

1-(aminomethyl)cyclohexanacetic acid

DESCRIPTION

Gabapentin is prescribed -- usually in combination with other medications -- for the treatment of seizure disorders, though its anticonvulsant mechanism is not known. It is sometimes prescribed for the management of neuralgia (nerve pain) and has been prescribed off-label for the treatment of mood disorders, anxiety, and tardive dyskinesia (a neurological syndrome caused by the long-term use of neuroleptic drugs).

BASICS

EFFECTS

IMAGES

HEALTH

LAW

DOSE

CHEMISTRY

GENERAL INFORMATION #

Notes on the Medical Uses of Gabapentin

Neurontin for Detoxing from GHB Addiction

RELATED VAULTS #

Pregabalin (Lyrica)

EXPERIENCES #

Some Public Singing, May Feel Like Zombie, by Rev. MeO

Good or Bad?, by Light Enigma

The World is Shiny, by GoodyTwoShoes

The Loop, by ArUcAmXeLa93


                    Context: 
                    This section provides an overview of gabapentin (brand name Neurontin), summarizing its classification as an anticonvulsant and tranquilizer, chemical name, medical uses (including treatment for seizure disorders, nerve pain, and various off-label applications), and links to related health information, user experiences, and similar pharmaceuticals within Erowid’s Pharmaceuticals Vault.
